meanings.definition: The horny projecting jaws of a bird.
meanings.sent1: The bird used its beaks to crack open a nut.
meanings.sent2: Birds use their beaks to catch and eat insects.
meanings.sent3: The beaks of the bird made it look like it was smiling.
meanings.sent4: Her beak was sharp and ready to peck at any threat.
meanings.sent5: The colorful beaks of parrots are a sight to behold.

meanings.definition: A similar structure forming the jaws of an octopus or other cephalopod.
meanings.sent1: The octopus's beaks are used to break open shells.
meanings.sent2: The cephalopod's beaks are strong and efficient for hunting.
meanings.sent3: The beaks of the octopus looked like tiny scissors.
meanings.sent4: Her beak-like tentacles grasped the prey tightly.
meanings.sent5: The sharp beaks of the squid can pierce through tough prey.

meanings.definition: A metal point fixed on the bows of a war galley, used for ramming an enemy ship.
meanings.sent1: The war galley's beaks were menacing in battle.
meanings.sent2: The beaks of the ship were designed for maximum impact.
meanings.sent3: The beaks of the galley gleamed in the sunlight, ready for battle.
meanings.sent4: The enemy ship was no match for the sharp beaks of our galley.
meanings.sent5: The beaks of the warship struck fear into the hearts of the enemy.
